info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 03 at 8:39AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN PREBLE, NORTHEASTERN BUTLER, NORTHWESTERN WARREN AND SOUTHWESTERN MONTGOMERY COUNTIES THROUGH 900 AM EDT... At 838 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Trenton, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Dayton, Kettering, Middletown, Trotwood, Miamisburg, Springboro, Monroe, Franklin, Moraine, Carlisle, West Carrollton, West Alexandria, Gratis, Hunter, Germantown, New Lebanon, Farmersville, Somerville, West Elkton and Centerville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
